properties.headline: Frost Advisory issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 3 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with
gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Frost Advisory,
temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For
the first Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 27
possible. For the second Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures
as low as 30 possible.

* WHERE...Ventura County Coastal Valleys.

* WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 3 AM to 9 AM PST Monday.
For the Wind Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to noon PST
Monday. For the first Freeze Watch, from late Monday night
through Tuesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from
late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and
make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds tonight.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
